page.title: 07Netley.
page.content: Netley on the shore of Southampton Water sits in between West Wood and Victoria Country Park.Just down from Netley Abbey,on the shore,is Netley Castle built by Henry V111 to protect the waterway.Netley Catle is now used as a Convalescent Home for people from the Southampton area.The Abbey was disolved by Henry and some of the stones were used to build the Castle. Legend has it though that the foreman was killed by a falling stone and the men refused to work there any more that's why so much of the ruin remains. After World War 2 a large{Council {Estate}was built here.These houses are now being modernised. The shopping area along the shore has a number of shops and restaurants to cater for the boating enthusiasts during the summer.
